key_0.name: Grateful Dead
key_0.set1: Stealin' (tk 4-5 instr), Stealin' (tk 6), I Know You Rider (version 1 tk 1), Don't Ease Me In (version 1 tk 1-2-3 instr), Don't Ease Me In (version 1 tk 4-5-6 instr), Don't Ease Me In (version 1 tk 7-8 instr), Don't Ease Me In (version 2 tk 1-2-3 instr), Don't Ease Me In (version 2 tk 4-5 instr), Don't Ease Me In (version 2 tk 6), Don't Ease Me In (version 2 tk 7-8 instr), You Don't Have To Ask (tk 12-13-14), Taste Bud (tk 1 instr), Taste Bud (tk 2), Cardboard Cowboy (tk 2 instr), Cardboard Cowboy (tk 3 instr), Cardboard Cowboy (tk 4 instr), Cardboard Cowboy (tk 5), Stealin' (tk 1 instr), I Know You Rider (version 2 tk 1 instr), I Know You Rider (version 2 tk 2), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 1 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 2 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 3 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 4 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 5 instr)
key_0.set2: Cold Rain And Snow (tk 6 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 7 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 8 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 9 instr), Cold Rain And Snow (tk 10), Instrumental, I Know You Rider (tk 1 instr), Ripple, My Sweet Little Angel (Pigpen vocals), Mason's Children, Uncle John's Band, Shakedown Street, Fire On The Mountain, Pride Of Cucamonga (3 tks), Money Money, Guitar Instrumental, Unbroken Chain (2 tks)

key_13.name: Grateful Dead
key_13.set1:
*11/3/65 San Francisco,CA Demos for Autumn Records: Can't Come Down, Mindbender, The Only Time Is Now, I Know You Rider, Early Morning Rain
*Early '66 1st Single Session for Scorpio Records: Don't Ease Me In, Stealin'
*Early '66 Pre 1st LP Outtakes: You Don't Have to Ask, I Know You Rider, Cardboard Cowboy, I Know You Rider (instrumental), The Lindy, The Lindy(instrumental), Alice D. Millionaire, Alice D. Millionaire (instrumental).
*Early '66 Neal Cassidy Unreleased Film Music: Speed Limit-instrumental w/ Neal Cassidy talking
*Early '66 Menlo Park Demos: Sick and Tired, Mindbender, New Things Running Around My Mind
*Early '67 Acetate not used for 1st LP: Broken Heart
*Early '67 Acetate of Unreleased Movie Soundtrack from 'Fire in the City': Fire In The City Tonight (Jazz Singer-Jon Hendrick on vocals)
*1967 Burbank,CA Acetate Burbank Studios: Lovelight

key_14.name: Grateful Dead
key_14.set1: talk & tunings - "It's just Weir and his ass-holed guitar" Viola Lee Blues #1 verse 1 - aborted Viola Lee Blues #2 verses 1 & 2 - aborted - "watch it pig! b, man, b" talk & tunings Viola Lee Blues #3 with harmonica - aborted discussions Viola Lee Blues #4 with organ verse 1 & harmonica - aborted tape playback? more talk Viola Lee Blues #5 verse 1 - "same verse again" - verse 1 - aborted Phil comments Viola Lee Blues #6 verses 1 & 2 - aborted more discussions Viola Lee Blues #7 verses 1 & 2 & 3 - then stopped talk & tunings - "that's tasty" - "let's just play" Viola Lee Blues #8 verse 1 - aborted talk & wild comments & confusion Viola Lee Blues #9 verses 2 & 3 - aborted more talk - "I think you're against us" - "Pigpen's a conspiracy" "You may know by ..." passage repeated Viola Lee Blues #10 verses 1 & 2 & 3 ; jam ; tape cuts
key_14.comment: January-February 1966 ?? (exact date unknown) "The Viola Lee Blues Rehearsals" This is a wonderful piece of Dead rehearsal tape that I have not seen circulating in the digital realm. The cassette was played back on Nak CR7E with azimuth adjustment. Sound Forge was used for noise reduction. Research and A>D transfer by Uli Teute Sound tweaking and SHN seeding by Hanno Bunjes August 2003

key_102.set2: Smokestack Lightning-> I'm A King Bee, Midnight Hour
key_102.comment:
Other Artists On Bill: James Cotton Blues Band; Lothar & The Hand People.
*Bill Graham Introduces The Grateful Dead As "The Charles Atlas Of The Psychedelic Set". A Liberated Bootleg CD That Circulates Of This Show Is Missing The Bill Graham Intro, Has 'Cold Rain & Snow' Inserted Between 'Pain In My Heart' And 'Beat It On Down The Line', And Is Also Missing 'Dancin' In The Streets'.
**11 Beat BIODTL.

key_124.name: Grateful Dead
key_124.set1: ~10 rehearsals of Viola Lee Blues, with banter
key_124.comment: Date uncertain, possibly January-February 1966. Note the ??/??/66 material that was redundantly listed here in the db prior to 8/2003 is elsewhere instead (~2 users may want to move). This entry is now for Viola Lee Rehearsals. Thanks, admin. entered as "Portland Acid Test - day uncertain"; Owsley's comments quoted at deadlists.com: "Portland acid test was either on Dec 18 '65, or Jan 15 '66"; this setlist submitted by user from GDH 557, marked "??/??/66 date uncertain"

key_125.name: Grateful Dead
key_125.set1:
circa '66 Total time 56:36
1. She's On The Road Again (2:48) 2. Next Time You See Me (3:30) 3. I Know You Rider (2:53) 4. Hey Little One (5:16) 5. Cold Rain & Snow (3:09) 6. King Bee > (6:03) 7. Caution (8:38) 8. Stealin' // (1:13) a user's Note: tracks 1-8 are reportedly from 2/25/66 Ivar Theater, Los Angeles. I find that exceedingly hard to believe. The material here is much tighter and the recording far better than those from 3/12 or 3/25. I date the above material from May or later. 9. Stealin' (3:02) Note: From late summmer 66. 10. Good Morning, Lil' School Girl > (7:43) 11. You Don't Love Me > (5:38) 12. Good Morning, Lil' School Girl (6:35)

key_126.name: Grateful Dead
key_126.comment: This is a placeholder entry for a circulating compilation of Acid Test and supplemental material from various dates. There are 3 discs' worth of '66 tests, reportedly: 1/8/66, 1/29/66, 3/12/66, 10/2/66, 10/31/66. There is an additional disc of Cassady and/or Jerry tracks from '65 and/or '67. Individual dates for the tests will also be listed in the db. The db structure precludes the use of date-range entries.

key_127.name: Grateful Dead
key_127.set1:
Grateful Dead & Merry Pranksters The Acid Test Reels - 1965-1967 A chronological compilation of the Acid Test recordings listed in The Grateful Dead Tapers Compendium Volume One.
DISC ONE: Fillmore Acid Test/Sound City Acid Test The Fillmore Acid Test Fillmore Auditorium, San Francisco, CA - January 8, 1966 1. Stage Chaos/More Power Rap 2. King Bee 3. I'm A Hog For You Baby 4. Caution: Do Not Step On Tracks > 5. Death Don't Have No Mercy 6. Star Spangled Banner / closing remarks
The Sound City Acid Test 363 6th Street, San Francisco, CA - January 29, 1966 7. Ken Kesey interviewed by Frank Fey 8. Ken Babbs and harmonica 9. Take Two: Ken Kesey 10. Bull 11. Peggy The Pistol 12. One-way Ticket 13. Bells And Fairies 14. Levitation 15. Trip X 16. The End
7-16 The Acid Test: A Sound City Production
DISC TWO: Pico Acid Test /S.F. State U Acid Test (pt.1) The Pico Acid Test Danish Center, Los Angeles, CA - March 12, 1966 1. Viola Lee Blues 2. You See A Broken Heart 3. In The Midnight Hour
The San Francisco State Acid Test Whatever It Is Festival San Francisco State University, San Francisco, CA Stereo Control Room Master (rec. 4:00AM - 6:00AM)- October 2, 1966 4. The Head Has Become Fat Rap 5. A Mexican Story: 25 Bennies 6. A Tarnished Galahad 7. Get It Off The Ground Rap > 8. It's Good To Be God Rap > 9. Nirvana Army Rap > 10. The Butcher Is Back 11. Acid Test Graduation Announcement 12. Send Me To The Moon >Closing Rap
Credits on 10/2/66: Voices: Ken Kesey and Hugh Romney Guitar: Ken Kesey Violin: Dale Kesey Organ: Jerry Garcia Engineering: Steve Newman, Ken Kesey, Mountain Girl
DISC THREE: S.F. State U Acid Test (pt. 2)/Graduation Jam The San Francisco State Acid Test Whatever It Is Festival San Francisco State University, San Francisco, CA - October 2, 1966 1. Ken Kesey's dialogue (isolated remix)
Merry Prankster Sound Collage Sequences - October 2, 1966 2. Prankster Music/Sound Collage #1(sequence 1) 3. Kesey Rap > Prankster Music/Sound Collage #2 (sequence 2) 4. Prankster Sound Collage #3 > Prankster Raga(sequence 3)
Prankster Recordings broadcast over the P.A. End of Whatever It Is Festival - October 2, 1966 5. Closing Jam 6. Prankster Electronics
Acid Test Graduation Jam Winterland, San Francisco, CA - October 31, 1966 7. Jam Session (musicians unknown) from The World Of Acid film soundtrack
Disc Four: Related Recordings Neal Cassidy & The Warlocks 1965 1. Speed Limit studio recording/Prankster production tape circa late 1965 Straight Theater, Haight Street, San Francisco, CA - July 23, 1967 2. Neal Cassidy Raps (backed by The Dead) recording released as a flexi-disc in the 1st printing of The Dead Book
Acid Tests Production Reel 3. Jerry Garcia commentary with Acid Test audio 710 Haight Street House, San Francisco, CA - summer 1967
4. - 6. Jerry Garcia one hour interview about music, drugs, politics and social changes circa 1967
The 1h Jerry interview on disc 4 is split into 3 smaller pieces (a-c).
key_127.comment: A chronological compilation of the Acid Test recordings listed in The Grateful Dead Tapers Compendium Volume One.

key_128.name: Grateful Dead
key_128.set1:
?Vintage Dead? Avalon Ballroom, San Francisco Sunflower/MGM (SUN-5001, October 1970)
1 Disc 01 I Know You Rider 04:24 02 It Hurts Me Too 04:25 03 It's All Over Now Baby Blue 04:54 04 Dancing in the Street 06:56 05 In the Midnight Hour 18:28
39:11
key_128.set2:
?Historic Dead? Avalon Ballroom, San Francisco Sunflower/MGM (SNF-5004 May/June 1971)
06 Good Morning Little Schoolgirl 11:06 07 Lindy 03:03 08 Stealin' 03:03 09 The Same Thing 12:03
29:16
key_128.set3:
"The History Of The Grateful Dead"(Pride/MGM PRD-0016) 1 LP compilation of tracks from this set.
Dancin' In The Streets Lindy Stealin' It's All Over Now Baby Blue I Know You Rider Midnight Hour It Hurts Me Too
key_128.comment:
Musicians: Jerry Garcia , Bob Weir, *Pigpen, Phil Lesh, Bill Kreutzmann
Recorded Live at the Avalon Ballroom, San Francisco, 1966 (possibly recorded on September 16 and 17, 1966, which are the nights shown on the Kelly / Mouse poster seen on the cover) Tracks 8, 9 possibly recorded on November 1966 at The Matrix, San Francisco
Produced and Engineered by Robert Cohen (Tracks 8,9 Produced by Peter Abram) Edit and Remix by Richard Delvy
Cover art - John Pierce, Mokelvey (Vintage) Back cover photos - Baron Wolman (Vintage) Poster design - Kelly / Mouse Studios (Vintage) Ripple Bottle by Gallo (Vintage) Album design - Robert Hickson (Historic)
Original LP master tapes remastered for CD at Polygram (1995) > DAT > CDR
Background on these LPs: These 2 LPs were release without explicit permission from the Dead.Producer Robert Cohen (a bit more on Mr. Cohen here: http://www.lumiereprod.com/history.html) got the masters from recordingsmade at the Avalon, adding applause and other sounds where needed to helpthe flow (there is a bit of audio, a small segment with some mostlyinaudible band chatter, which was added to "extend" tracks so theywouldn't end so abruptly. The same segment used in a couple of differentspots, once as a loop that repeats 2-3 times). Some of the songs have cutintros, but are segued with applause anyway. These are pretty muchbootleg quality from today's perspective, and frankly most interest inthese LPs is because of their status as collectibles rather than beingworthwhile musically. But fans of the early days will especially enjoythe lengthy workouts of "Midnight Hour", "The Same Thing" and "GoodMorning Little Schoolgirl".
Some info on the Sunflower label: http://www.bsnpubs.com/mgm/sunflower.html
Footnote: An LP released in 1973, "The History Of The Grateful Dead"(Pride/MGM PRD-0016), compiled the following tracks from the SunflowerLPs: Dancin' In The Street, It's All Over Now, Baby Blue, I Know YouRider, In The Midnight Hour, It Hurts Me Too, Lindy and Stealin'. Therewas also an official release on Warners released in 1973 with virtuallythe same title (subtitled "Bear's Choice", as we all know), so the PrideLP couldn't have been very welcome at that time.
